definition: to chant a magic spell/to recite incantations

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud
incantation/magic spell/curse/malediction/to revile/to put a curse on sb

sentences.english: The wizard uttered a spell against the wicked king.
sentences.chinese: 男巫对作恶多端的国王念咒法。

sentences.english: “They imagined we were dressing up in robes and chanting,” he says.
sentences.chinese: “他们想象我们穿着长袍在念咒，”他说。

sentences.english: It's a mantra of the age of globalization that where we live doesn't matter.
sentences.chinese: 在全球化时代我们住哪并不重要像念咒声充塞耳畔。

definition: incantation/magic spell/curse/malediction/to revile/to put a curse on sb
to read out/to recite/to remember sb (while talking about sth else)
to implement the law/to perform sorcery
variant of 念念有詞|念念有词[nian4 nian4 you3 ci2]
to recite or chant Buddhist scripture
true statement/incantation (translates Sanskrit: dharani 陀羅尼|陀罗尼)
to surpass/to transcend/to perform religious ceremonies to help the soul find peace
